content:
Certainly! Here are some resources where you can find more information about the strategies used by countries to manage their borders during the pandemic:

1. The World Health Organization (WHO) provides a wealth of information on global health and pandemic response strategies. You can visit their website for more information on how different countries have responded to COVID-19: https://www.who.int/emergencies/disease-outbreak-news/item/2020-DON229

2. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is another great resource that provides information on how countries have managed their borders during the pandemic. You can visit their website for more information: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/map-and-travel-notices.html

3. The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) provides regularly updated information on COVID-19 and its impact on travel and border controls within the European Union. You can visit their website for more information: https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/en/novel-coronavirus/latest-evidence/travel-measures

4. The International Air Transport Association (IATA) also provides resources and updates on how countries are managing their borders and travel restrictions during the pandemic. You can visit their website for more information: https://www.iata.org/en/programs/covid-19-resources-guidelines/for-travelers/
